posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This one build is made for the troops of Alexander the Great, they were the best trained spearmen in the known world and they were wielding the Sarisa (Macedonian long Lance) a very long spear that made them victorious in innumerable bettles. To give them resilience i went with Pale Master, to represent their superior training only Weapon Masters could fit the bill and to tie all these Bard had to be choosen. And although this combination looks feat-starved it comes out very nicely from start to finish with very good playability and power that only increases as the levels go up.

Tips for playing the Undead Phalanx:

You will want to start with a breastplate and tower shield wielding your morningstar till you have the boost in your AC from the early Pale master lvls. Then you can switch to Spear and never look back. In early epics you will get another boost to your Ac from your Full plate armour and the immunities from Pale master will keep you safe. Notice that you get Weapon's master augmented criticals before epic levels and skill dumps from intermediate Bard lvls along the road. The later Weapo master levels will make you a beast since they rise your Ab to a significant degree and give you all the epic feats you want in order of significance. With this build you will also have 4th lvl Bard Spells along with a good 11th lvl Bard Song, use them to further augment your power, in times that you need them.

Build Variation: Originally i made another workable build similar to this that has minor differences. It is a (BARD 9/ PM 12/ WM 19) that has 2nd lvl Bard spells and 9th lvl Bard song but +2 AC more and +4 Fortitude. It's structure is similar to this one, if you need further details i can post this one as well below. It is my opinion that the later is slightly stronger in a rich UMD environment like WoG, but anyway the differences are small and up to the personal taste of each one.

Similar Builds:

1) The Pale Weapon Master, with similar split as mine but with pretty much lower stats and reduced playability.
2) Spear of the Cambions, it has +2 AB more than mine but alas, only three attacks/round, a feeble Bard song and lower AC.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I think it is a mistake vesting in more than CHA 11-12 without stilled spells and the chosen bias for heavy armor.  Without holding shield, it will help failure some but essentially this toon should be casting exclusively from scrolls/items and be a dedicated low-level singer at most (No Lingering Song to help out either) .

Going to INT alone allows a much needed max Taunt skill which will help compensate for a pedestrian AB, pedestrian for a WM that is.  Another point in DEX wouldn't hurt either for the extra reflex, with saves being the weak point of the build.

The true alignment restriction is: TN/NE/CN/CE.  NE appears to be thematic.

I like the build.  I just don't find it optimized.  And with many of your builds, it would be considerate to illustrate where you carry skills over for the dump level-by-level.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Pedestrian AB that might be for a pure WM, but otherwise it has a really nice AB (44 +2 from Song) for a Pale Master (they often have 40 AB at most) and this build is Both!

As for the build itself, i wanted to give players the full allotment of Bard's Spells up to 4th level for buffing reasons beforehand but if you can collect some Wands (the smart choice) here is what i would do instead...
I would lower Charisma to the absolute minimum (11) and put there 1 point in Intellect (14) and 2 points to Strength (16) and instead of taking a Great STR in Epic levels i would take ESF: Taunt. With the extra skill points from (14) Intellect i would max-out Taunt as a skill, thus having a pure 53 Taunt. Take last level as Bard if need be. That would be their famous (Come and Get it!) thing ;)
